intro: Lisianthius tetragonoalatus, commonly known as the four-sided lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its distinctive four-sided stem and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
